headline: The AI Trade Has Stocks Near Highs Again. Some Tech Names Remain on the Sidelines
summary: This latest iteration of the AI hype train features massive rallies in stocks like  Oracle  and  Broadcom  Both surged after reporting quarterly results that specifically spelled out how artificial intelligence will drive sales and profit in the coming quarters.  While there could be some credence to that argument—particularly considering that an OpenAI investment helped boost Oracle—the market’s distinction between winners and losers during second-quarter earnings season has taken on a new dynamic.  Strategists at Goldman Sachs recently highlighted this trend in a note to clients.

headline: Workday Introduces Workday Data Cloud to Unlock the Power of People and Money Data and Accelerate AI-Powered Innovation
summary: Workday Rising 2025 -- Workday, Inc. (NASDAQ: WDAY), the enterprise AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, today announced Workday Data Cloud, a new data layer that will help organizations unlock the strategic value of their HR and finance data by connecting it to their existing analytics platforms and operational systems. Customers will get rich, secure, real-time access to insights – turning workforce and financial information into action faster than ever.

headline: Accounting Seed names Nasser Chanda CEO to drive next phase of growth
summary: Accounting Seed, the #1 accounting system built on Salesforce, announced today that Nasser Chanda has joined as Chief Executive Officer. Chanda brings a proven track record of scaling technology companies, having previously served as CEO of Paymerang, a leading AP automation provider that he guided to 1,500% revenue growth over eight years before its sale to Corpay in 2024.

headline: US online holiday sales growth to slow as shoppers tighten budgets, Salesforce forecasts
summary: Salesforce projects online spending between November 1 and December 31 to rise 2.1% to $288 billion, lower than a 4% increase to $282 billion in the same period last year.  The outlook echoes recent reports from Deloitte and PwC, underscoring a subdued holiday season that will see shoppers prioritize essentials, hunt for deeper discounts and cut back on discretionary purchases as economic uncertainty weighs on sentiment.  In recent weeks, major retailers have issued mixed forecasts heading into the crucial holiday season.

headline: Salesforce (CRM): Assessing Valuation Following Strong Earnings, Raised Guidance, and $20B Buyback Expansion
summary: If you own Salesforce (CRM) or are just keeping an eye on it, this past week has certainly given you something to think about. The company just released a series of headline-making updates: quarterly earnings came in stronger than anticipated, management revised their full-year guidance upward, and, perhaps most notably, Salesforce boosted its share buyback program by an additional $20 billion. Moves like these are the kind that tend to grab Wall Street’s attention and often get investors...

headline: Close-Up International Acquires Pharma CRM Provider MobileDotRep to Expand U.S. Presence and Compete with Veeva and Salesforce
summary: PRINCETON, N.J., Sept. 16, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Close-Up Intl, a global leader in AI-powered CRM market data and business intelligence solutions for the pharmaceutical industry, has announced it acquired MobileDotRep, a life sciences CRM solution provider based out of Thousand Oaks, CA. This acquisition is another milestone for Close-Up, who has been a pioneer in pharma CRM since 1994 and a 5-Star rated Pharma CRM provider on Gartner’s Peer Insights: https://www.gartner.com/reviews/market/cr
